msDesc.head: A fragmentary manuscript of only ten leaves, of which the final is in the wrong position and should in fact be the first. Many of the enlarged initials, which were probably gold leaf, have been cut out, leaving lacunæ on the reverse. One rubric is given in Low German; the manuscript is otherwise only in Danish.

msItem.title: 15 Os
msItem.author: Pseudo-Birgitta
msItem.incipit: O Jhesu criste alsom stærckeste loffue
msItem.explicit: them ther thesse bøner fulkomme gudelig Amen

msItem.title: Five Sorrows of Mary
msItem.rubric: Thet war een hetherlig qwinne och mærckelig [...]
Her byries wor ffrwe sorgher et cetera
msItem.incipit: MJn kiære Jomffrw maria Jech beder tich for then første sorgh
msItem.explicit: til then ewærdelig glede ther aldrig kommer ændhe wppoo Amen

msItem.title: Seven Joys of Mary
msItem.rubric: Her byries Jomffrw Maria hennes gleder etc
msItem.incipit: MJn kerre Jomffrw sancta Maria wordhe thet tig till ære
msItem.explicit: ock kom mith maal i godh ænde i gutz naffn Amen

msItem.title: A Prayer to the Virgin Mary
msItem.rubric: Her børies een god bøn aff Jomffrw Mariæ
msItem.explicit: fræls mich aff all myn drøuelsse ther mith kan schade bode till liff oc till siel Amen

msItem.title: Ten Joys of Mary
msItem.rubric: Uultu weten wo dit beth vp erden is gekomen [...]
msItem.explicit: fulkomme myn bøn effter thin nade oc effter myn begeringe Amen

msItem.title: 15 Joys of St. Anne
msItem.rubric: Hwo som thesse effterschreffne xv gleder gwdelig læs [...]
msItem.explicit: bed for mich meth thin kære dotter amen

msItem.incipit: Helige ffrw sancta Anna oc thin werduge dotter

msItem.title: 15 Os
msItem.author: Pseudo-Birgitta
msItem.explicit: Jech beder tig Liws mith hiærtte meth eth andeligt Liws amen

item.desc: The surviving fragment was originally a single quinternion quire.
Quaternion. Originally a quinterion with the following bifolium
Bifolium. Originally the first and final leaves of a quinternion.

history.origin: Written in Denmark in the late fifteenth century.
history.acquisition: Bought at the auction of Frederik Rostgård as item number 360.
